newsitem.title: USA: Clinton to ask FCC to mull liquor ad limits - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Clinton to ask FCC to mull liquor ad limits - NYT.

text.p: President Clinton will ask the U.S. Federal Communications Commission to review the possibility of banning or sharply restricting liquor advertisements on television, the New York Times said Tuesday.

Clinton would express concern over last year's decision by the liquor industry to remove a voluntary policy against advertising on television, the paper said, citing officials. The paper said a letter would be sent to the FCC on Tuesday.
The president would ask the FCC to examine if the ads encouraged young people to try drinking, it said.
